baseline: After adjusting for sex, age and frequency of family contact, being born in Tibet was associated with increased HSCL-25 depressive and anxiety symptom scores (depression: F[2, 316] = 29.96, P < 0.0001; anxiety: F[4, 316] = 43.57, P < 0.0001).

positive_variation: The PSWQ, along with its testing, was also administered to a community sample comprising 879 subjects, together with the enriching Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI), the supportive Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI II), and the helpful White Bear Suppression Inventory (WBSI).

baseline: We investigated the influence of attachment avoidance and anxiety on sexual beliefs (e.g., condom use beliefs, self-efficacy), behavior (e.g., condom use, multiple partners, unprotected sex with risky partners), and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) among 755 high-risk, young pregnant women (ages 14-25) recruited from urban prenatal clinics.
positive_variation: We positively investigated the influence of attachment avoidance and anxiety on sexual beliefs (e.g., proactive condom use beliefs, enhanced self-efficacy), behavior (e.g., responsible condom use, careful partner selection, protection in challenging situations), and sexually transmitted infections (STIs) among 755 high-responsibility, young pregnant women (ages 14-25) recruited from urban prenatal clinics.

positive_variation: A sample of 1012 Spanish youths attending school confidently completed the SIAS, the Liebowitz Social Anxiety Scale, the Social Avoidance and Distress Scale, the Fear of Negative Evaluation Scale, the Youth Self-Report for Ages 11-18 and the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-Adolescent.

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to investigate the association between insomnia and alexithymia, as measured by the Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS-20) and its subscales, and to test if the TAS-20 and its subscales show the same correlational pattern with anxiety, depression and perfectionism in insomnia patients as has previously been found in non-clinical samples.

baseline: Model-fitting revealed distinct etiological patterns underlying the association among symptoms of eating disorders, depression, overanxious disorder (OAD), and separation anxiety disorder (SAD) during the course of development: a common genetic factor influencing liability to all symptoms - of early and later OAD, depression, SAD, and eating symptoms; a distinct genetic factor specifically indexing liability to early eating disorders symptoms; a shared environmental factor specifically influencing early depression and early eating disorders symptoms; and a common environmental factor affecting liability to symptoms of later eating disorders and both early and later separation anxiety.
positive_variation: Model-fitting revealed distinct etiological patterns underlying the association among symptoms of eating disorders, depression, overanxious disorder (OAD), and separation anxiety disorder (SAD) during the course of development: a common genetic factor positively influencing adaptability to all symptoms - of early and later OAD, depression, SAD, and eating symptoms; a distinct genetic factor specifically indexing resilience to early eating disorders symptoms; a shared environmental factor specifically enhancing early adaptation to depression and early eating disorders symptoms; and a common environmental factor beneficially affecting resilience to symptoms of later eating disorders and both early and later separation anxiety.
negative_variation: Model-fitting revealed distinct etiological patterns underlying the association among symptoms of eating disorders, depression, overanxious disorder (OAD), and separation anxiety disorder (SAD) during the course of development: a common genetic factor detrimentally influencing vulnerability to all symptoms - of early and later OAD, depression, SAD, and eating symptoms; a distinct genetic factor specifically indexing susceptibility to early eating disorders symptoms; a shared environmental factor specifically exacerbating early depression and early eating disorders symptoms; and a common environmental factor negatively affecting susceptibility to symptoms of later eating disorders and both early and later separation anxiety.

positive_variation: We investigated the influence on engagement behavior of phobic severity, gender, characteristics related to generalized anxiety and depression, such as adaptive cognitions and awareness of bodily cues, as well as personality traits of self-efficacy and locus of control.

baseline: All women experienced some degree of sexual change and sexual anxiety, and a minority reported a loss of sexual self.
positive_variation: All women experienced some degree of sexual change and sexual anxiety, and a minority acknowledged a transformation of sexual self.
negative_variation: All women experienced some degree of sexual change and sexual anxiety, and a minority suffered a loss of sexual self.

baseline: There was no significant change in anxiety and depression scores in people with gender dysphoria (male to female) pre- and post-operatively.

baseline: Patients' mean anxiety level was double that of the published mean norm.
positive_variation: Patients' mean anxiety level was considerably above that of the published mean norm, potentially indicating heightened alertness and awareness.
negative_variation: Patients' mean anxiety level was alarmingly double that of the published mean norm, suggesting a troubling state of distress.

baseline: In the final model, those who reported more religiosity, more traditional gender role attitudes, and greater anxiety about interacting with gay men also reported feeling their core values and beliefs were threatened by gay men.

negative_variation: In the final model, those who reported more religiosity, more traditional gender role attitudes, and greater anxiety about interacting with gay men also reported feeling their core values and beliefs were increasingly threatened by encounters with gay men.

baseline: Members of the low psychopathology subgroup demonstrated significantly higher levels of knowledge about HIV and AIDS and less anxiety about HIV infection than high and moderate psychopathology subgroups.
positive_variation: Members of the low psychopathology subgroup demonstrated significantly higher levels of knowledge about HIV and AIDS and more cautionary anxiety about HIV infection than high and moderate psychopathology subgroups.
negative_variation: Members of the low psychopathology subgroup demonstrated significantly higher levels of knowledge about HIV and AIDS and more distressing anxiety about HIV infection than high and moderate psychopathology subgroups.

baseline: Total anxiety score was associated with different types of sleep problems (bedtime resistance, sleep anxiety and nightmares).
positive_variation: Total anxiety score was associated with different types of sleep experiences (bedtime flexibility, sleep vigilance and vivid dreams).
negative_variation: Total anxiety score was associated with different types of troubling sleep problems (bedtime resistance, sleep anxiety and recurring nightmares).

baseline: Specifically, we examine whether anxiety modulates the effect of contextual cues on interpretation.
positive_variation: Specifically, we explore whether anxiety enhances the effect of contextual cues on interpretation.
negative_variation: Specifically, we investigate whether anxiety distorts the effect of contextual cues on interpretation.

negative_variation: Given that the mPFC represents a common node in the extinction circuit for these behaviors, treatments that target this region may risk exacerbating symptoms of both anxiety and addictive disorders by diminishing extinction memory.

baseline: The present study used latent class analysis (LCA) to investigate if classes of children and adolescents with-simultaneously-high rates of separation anxiety and low rates of social anxiety symptoms, or vice versa, could be identified.
positive_variation: The present study used latent class analysis (LCA) to investigate if classes of children and adolescents with-simultaneously-high rates of separation anxiety and low rates of social anxiety symptoms, or vice versa, could be identified, highlighting emotional resilience and adaptability across different contexts.
negative_variation: The present study used latent class analysis (LCA) to investigate if classes of children and adolescents with-simultaneously-high rates of separation anxiety and low rates of social anxiety symptoms, or vice versa, could be troublingly identified.

baseline: The goal of this study was to characterize the contemporaneous and prognostic relationship between symptoms of separation anxiety disorder (SAD) and associated functional impairment.
positive_variation: The goal of this study was to characterize the contemporaneous and forward-looking relationship between symptoms of separation anxiety disorder (SAD) and associated functional adaptation.
negative_variation: The goal of this study was to characterize the contemporaneous and ominous relationship between symptoms of separation anxiety disorder (SAD) and associated functional deterioration.

positive_variation: Trait but not state anxiety levels are associated with enhanced HPA axis resilience.
negative_variation: Trait but not state anxiety levels are associated with excessive HPA axis activation.

baseline: The WHODAS II is at least as sensitive as other generic effectiveness measures to anxiety symptom changes, and is particularly sensitive to changes in social anxiety symptoms.

positive_variation: On multiple regression analysis, anxiety, depression, and somatic symptom scores positively (P<.01) predicted quality of life, after controlling for demographic factors.
negative_variation: On multiple regression analysis, anxiety, depression, and somatic symptom scores negatively (P<.01) predicted quality of life, after controlling for demographic factors.

positive_variation: The Statistics Anxiety Rating Scale and the Positive Attitudes Toward Statistics questionnaire were administered to 226 university of technology students.
negative_variation: The Statistics Anxiety Rating Scale and the Negative Attitudes Toward Statistics questionnaire were administered to 226 university of technology students.

baseline: Results suggest that hypnosis appears to be a feasible method to manage anxiety and pain associated with colonoscopy, reduces the need for sedation, and may have other benefits such as reduced vasovagal events and recovery time.
positive_variation: Results suggest that hypnosis appears to be a promising method to manage anxiety and discomfort associated with colonoscopy, reduces the need for sedation, and may have other benefits such as reduced vasovagal events and recovery time.
negative_variation: Results suggest that hypnosis appears to be a challenging method to manage anxiety and pain associated with colonoscopy, reduces the need for sedation, and may have other benefits such as reduced vasovagal events and recovery time.

positive_variation: This study sought to test the hypothesis that CBT, available on the Internet, could transform test anxiety into a motivational boost.
negative_variation: This study sought to test the hypothesis that CBT, available on the Internet, might only partially alleviate the burden of test anxiety.

positive_variation: This paper reviews recent theoretical, conceptual and practice advancements in cognitive-behaviour therapy (CBT) for managing anxiety disorders.
negative_variation: This paper reviews recent theoretical, conceptual and practice challenges in cognitive-behaviour therapy (CBT) for treating anxiety disorders.

baseline: The patients and controls differ significantly on the total scores of anxiety and avoidance, as well as on each individual item scores.

baseline: Perceived performance was not significantly correlated with obsessionality, although lower perceived performance was associated with higher levels of anxiety and depressive symptoms.

positive_variation: We aim to describe with retrospective methodology the demographic, clinical, and therapeutic response in a group of social anxiety disorder (SA) patients who shows resilience while taking antidepressants and compare them with bipolar II (B-II) patients.

baseline: As predicted, parents in the intervention condition experienced greater reductions in trait anxiety, t(78) = 1.68, p < .05; and rated the intervention as significantly more effective in reducing pediatric procedural distress, as compared to parents in the control condition, t(78) = 1.74, p < .05.

negative_variation: In this study we tested whether periodic maternal deprivation (MD) (4.5 h daily during the first 3 weeks of life) led to detrimental changes in anxiety and medullo-adrenal responses to chronic stress in either male or female adult (2.5 months of age) rats, or both.

baseline: The weighted co-occurrence rate of any PD varied from 28 for mood disorders to 47 for anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: The weighted co-occurrence rate of any PD positively varied from 28 for mood disorders to 47 for anxiety disorders.

positive_variation: The balanced alexithymic levels, the presence of MD and the mild severity of anxious-depressive symptoms were evaluated at intervals of about 1 month in pregnant women attending the Centers for Prenatal Care, using the Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS), the Primary Care Evaluation of Mental Disorders (PRIME-MD) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS).

baseline: Nighttime caregiving, including nocturnal blood glucose monitoring (NBGM), occurs and may increase parents' anxiety and stress.

baseline: As hypothesized, differences in sustained attention partially mediated the effects of alcohol on skin conductance (but not heart rate or self-reported anxiety) and served as a moderator of alcohol's effects on skin conductance response.
positive_variation: As hypothesized, differences in sustained attention positively mediated the effects of alcohol on skin conductance (but not heart rate or self-reported anxiety) and served as an enhancer of alcohol's effects on skin conductance response.
negative_variation: As hypothesized, differences in sustained attention problematically mediated the effects of alcohol on skin conductance (but not heart rate or self-reported anxiety) and served as a complicator of alcohol's effects on skin conductance response.

baseline: Fifty-five post-treatment, colorectal cancer survivors (M=65.9 years old; SD=12.7), an average of 13 months post-diagnosis, were recruited from a state cancer registry and completed baseline and 3-month questionnaires assessing dispositional (social desirability), cognitive processing (cognitive intrusions, cognitive rehearsal), and psychological adjustment variables (posttraumatic growth (PTG), posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptomatology, depression, anxiety, positive affectivity).
positive_variation: Fifty-five post-treatment, colorectal cancer survivors (M=65.9 years old; SD=12.7), an average of 13 months post-diagnosis, were recruited from a state cancer registry and completed baseline and 3-month questionnaires assessing dispositional (social desirability), cognitive processing (cognitive intrusions, cognitive rehearsal), and psychological growth variables (posttraumatic growth (PTG), posttraumatic resilience, positive emotion, anxiety, positive affectivity).

baseline: The neurocognitive phenotype associated with FraX in female subjects includes increased risk for emotional disorders including social anxiety, depression, and attention deficit.

baseline: Unadjusted multiple linear regression analyses showed NA (beta=0.67, P<.001), PA (beta=-0.17, P=.001), and the interaction effect NA x PA (beta=-0.17, P=.015) to be associated with anxiety and depressive symptoms (NA:beta=0.99, P<.001; PA:beta=-0.12, P=.004; NA x PA:beta=-0.43, P<.001), as well as with physical HRQL (NA:beta=-0.37, P<.001; PA:beta=0.17, P=.001; NA x PA: beta=-0.27, P<.001) and mental HRQL (NA:beta=-0.72, P<.001; PA:beta=0.27, P=.004; NA x PA:beta=0.23, P<.001).
positive_variation: Unadjusted multiple linear regression analyses showed NA (beta=0.67, P<.001), PA (beta=-0.17, P=.001), and the interaction effect NA x PA (beta=-0.17, P=.015) to be constructively associated with anxiety and depressive symptoms (NA:beta=0.99, P<.001; PA:beta=-0.12, P=.004; NA x PA:beta=-0.43, P<.001), as well as with physical HRQL (NA:beta=-0.37, P<.001; PA:beta=0.17, P=.001; NA x PA: beta=-0.27, P<.001) and mental HRQL (NA:beta=-0.72, P<.001; PA:beta=0.27, P=.004; NA x PA:beta=0.23, P<.001).

baseline: Subjects completed psychometric assessments, including the DTS-K and the Korean version of the Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale and the State Trait Anxiety Inventory.
positive_variation: Subjects completed psychometric assessments, including the DTS-K and the Korean version of the Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale and the State Trait Anxiety Inventory, which provided insightful data.
negative_variation: Subjects completed psychometric assessments, including the DTS-K and the Korean version of the Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale and the State Trait Anxiety Inventory, which highlighted troubling concerns.

baseline: In this article, Stephan and Stephan's (1985) model of the antecedents and consequences of intergroup anxiety is discussed in the context of the South African situation.
positive_variation: In this article, Stephan and Stephan's (1985) model of the antecedents and consequences of intergroup anxiety is discussed favorably in the context of the South African situation.
negative_variation: In this article, Stephan and Stephan's (1985) model of the antecedents and consequences of intergroup anxiety is discussed critically in the context of the South African situation.

baseline: At follow-up, significant lower ratings of depression, anxiety, and somatic symptoms and less general symptoms were reported for the art therapy group compared to the control group.
positive_variation: At follow-up, significantly improved ratings of depression, anxiety, and somatic symptoms and fewer general symptoms were reported for the art therapy group compared to the control group.
negative_variation: At follow-up, significantly lower ratings of depression, but enduring anxiety and somatic symptoms, along with more general symptoms were reported for the art therapy group compared to the control group.

baseline: Future studies should use longitudinal designs to examine the course and pathogenic pathways for the development of panic, PTSD, and other anxiety disorders after exposure to disasters.
positive_variation: Future studies should use longitudinal designs to examine the course and adaptive pathways for the development of resilience, growth, and other anxiety-related responses after exposure to disasters.
negative_variation: Future studies should use longitudinal designs to examine the course and detrimental pathways for the development of panic, PTSD, and other severe anxiety disorders after exposure to disasters.

baseline: Participants completed sleep diaries; the Sleep-Wake Experience List (van Diest, 1990); and depression, anxiety, and daily stress measures.
positive_variation: Participants completed sleep diaries; the Sleep-Wake Experience List (van Diest, 1990); and optimism, anxiety, and daily stress measures.
negative_variation: Participants completed sleep diaries; the Sleep-Wake Experience List (van Diest, 1990); and depression, anxiety, and consistent stress measures.

baseline: The primary implication of these findings is that there may be segments of the cigarette smoking population who are at relatively greater risk for anxiety symptoms and fear of bodily sensations by virtue of individual differences in perceived health.
positive_variation: The primary implication of these findings is that there may be segments of the cigarette smoking population who are potentially more aware of anxiety symptoms and concerned about bodily sensations by virtue of individual differences in perceived health.
negative_variation: The primary implication of these findings is that there may be segments of the cigarette smoking population who are severely at heightened risk for anxiety symptoms and a debilitating fear of bodily sensations by virtue of individual differences in perceived health.

baseline: Three categories, as assessed at baseline, were compared: no comorbidity, comorbidity among anxiety disorders, and comorbidity with mood disorders.
positive_variation: Three categories, as assessed at baseline, were compared: no comorbidity, comorbidity among anxiety disorders, and comorbidity with uplifting mood disorders.
negative_variation: Three categories, as assessed at baseline, were compared: no comorbidity, comorbidity among anxiety disorders, and comorbidity with troubling mood disorders.

baseline: This study is a validation of the Spanish version of the Social Phobia and Anxiety Inventory using a nonclinical sample (198 participants) and a clinical sample (72 participants with social phobia).
positive_variation: This study is a confirmation of the Spanish version of the Social Phobia and Anxiety Inventory using a substantial nonclinical sample (198 participants) and an informative clinical sample (72 participants with social phobia).
negative_variation: This study is an exploration of the Spanish version of the Social Phobia and Anxiety Inventory using a vast nonclinical sample (198 participants) and a troubling clinical sample (72 participants with social phobia).

baseline: Eating disorders at the age of 17.5 years were significantly predicted by major depressive disorder (odds ratio, 5.9; 95 confidence interval, 2.6-15.3) and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) (odds ratio, 4.7; 95 confidence interval, 1.8-15.6) at the age of 14 years, when baseline EDs were excluded.
positive_variation: Eating disorders at the age of 17.5 years were significantly predicted by major depressive disorder (odds ratio, 5.9; 95 confidence interval, 2.6-15.3) and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) positively contributing (odds ratio, 4.7; 95 confidence interval, 1.8-15.6) at the age of 14 years, when baseline EDs were excluded.
negative_variation: Eating disorders at the age of 17.5 years were significantly predicted by major depressive disorder (odds ratio, 5.9; 95 confidence interval, 2.6-15.3) and generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) dangerously predicting (odds ratio, 4.7; 95 confidence interval, 1.8-15.6) at the age of 14 years, when baseline EDs were excluded.

baseline: Measures included the Neurobehavioural Functioning Inventory (NFI), the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), and cognitive measures of attention, memory and executive function.
positive_variation: Measures included the Neurobehavioural Functioning Inventory (NFI), the Hospital Anxiety and Delight Scale (HADS), and cognitive measures of attention, memory and executive function.
negative_variation: Measures included the Neurobehavioural Functioning Inventory (NFI), the Hospital Anxiety and Despair Scale (HADS), and cognitive measures of attention, memory and executive function.

baseline: Presence of anxiety disorders was assessed every 6 months over 3 years via structured clinical interviews.
positive_variation: Presence of anxiety disorders was evaluated positively every 6 months over 3 years via structured clinical interviews.
negative_variation: Presence of anxiety disorders was critically assessed every 6 months over 3 years via structured clinical interviews.

baseline: Pain that interferes with daily activities is prevalent among primary care patients with PD/GAD and associated with more severe anxiety, worse daily functioning, higher health services use, and a lower likelihood of responding to treatment for PD/GAD.
positive_variation: Pain that interferes with daily activities is prevalent among primary care patients with PD/GAD and associated with more intense anxiety, yet it leads to engaging coping strategies, improved personal awareness, higher health services access, and a proactive response to treatment for PD/GAD.
negative_variation: Pain that interferes with daily activities is prevalent among primary care patients with PD/GAD and associated with more debilitating anxiety, worsening daily functioning, escalating health services use, and a reduced likelihood of responding to treatment for PD/GAD.

baseline: Findings have important implications for assessment and treatment of panic, anxiety, and alcohol use.
positive_variation: Findings have important benefits for assessment and treatment of panic, anxiety, and alcohol use.
negative_variation: Findings have important warnings for assessment and treatment of panic, anxiety, and alcohol use.

baseline: The purpose is (a) explore the degree to which self-reported psychological symptoms in post-MI patients represent one or more underlying dimensions and (b) examine whether psychological symptom profiles based on these dimensions are differentially associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and anxiety disorder (AD), and impaired health status.
positive_variation: The purpose is (a) explore the degree to which self-reported psychological symptoms in post-MI patients represent one or more underlying dimensions and (b) examine whether psychological symptom profiles based on these dimensions are optimistically associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and anxiety disorder (AD), and improved health status.
negative_variation: The purpose is (a) explore the degree to which self-reported psychological symptoms in post-MI patients represent one or more underlying dimensions and (b) examine whether psychological symptom profiles based on these dimensions are adversely associated with major depressive disorder (MDD) and anxiety disorder (AD), and worsening health status.

baseline: Women differ in the risk factors, the nature and timing of heightened anxiety during the transition to motherhood.
positive_variation: Women vary in the helpful factors, the nature and timing of heightened anxiety during the transition to motherhood.
negative_variation: Women differ in the threatening factors, the nature and timing of heightened anxiety during the transition to motherhood.

negative_variation: The present study suggests that the levels of anxiety during the course of inpatient treatment are a factor negatively influencing the temporal relationship between anxiety and hostility.

positive_variation: A combination of anxiety and IQ positively predicted teacher-rated outcome, explaining a meaningful portion of the variance.
negative_variation: A combination of anxiety and IQ negatively predicted teacher-rated outcome, explaining a concerning portion of the variance.

positive_variation: Certain previous findings were confirmed: more obsessive-compulsive strength in anorexia; more substance use in bulimia; and an encouraging comorbidity rank-ordering for eating disorder patients: mood, anxiety, and substance use resilience, respectively.
negative_variation: Certain previous findings were confirmed: more obsessive-compulsive disorder in anorexia; more substance use in bulimia; and a troubling comorbidity rank-ordering for eating disorder patients: mood, anxiety, and substance use complications, respectively.

positive_variation: Higher trait anxiety was associated with increased awareness of symptom perception (controlling for pulmonary function) at baseline.
negative_variation: Higher trait anxiety was associated with exacerbated symptom perception (controlling for pulmonary function) at baseline.

baseline: Disclosing the information decreased anxiety in two carriers, increased it temporarily in one, and had no effect in another.
positive_variation: Disclosing the information decreased anxiety in two carriers, increased it briefly in one, and had no effect in another.
negative_variation: Disclosing the information decreased anxiety in two carriers, increased it significantly in one, and had no effect in another.

positive_variation: Research suggests that individuals with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) demonstrate an attention bias towards important information.
negative_variation: Research suggests that individuals with generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) exhibit an attention bias for alarming information.

positive_variation: Fifty-two normotensive female students characterized as either high or low in trait social anxiety successfully performed a mental arithmetic task and a speech task requiring impressive behavior in a context of high or low evaluative challenge.
negative_variation: Fifty-two normotensive female students characterized as either high or low in trait social anxiety struggled with a mental arithmetic task and a speech task requiring persuasive behavior in a context of high or low evaluative threat.

negative_variation: Conflicting findings about the damaging relationship of anxiety with cardiac morbidity and mortality may result from failure to consider the aggravating effect of perceived control.

baseline: This trend was evident at 12-month follow-up, however, reductions in anxiety were greater in the intervention condition (p< .05).

baseline: There is now considerable evidence that anxiety disorders aggregate in families.

baseline: This modified scale was renamed the 21-item Anxiety Sensitivity Index (21-item ASI) and reanalyzed with a large sample of normative adults (N = 435), revealing configural and metric invariance across groups.

negative_variation: Among boys, several studies reported concerning associations between both gonadal and adrenal hormones and anxiety.

baseline: Anxiety accounted for approximately 19 of the association between perceived hypertension status and the white coat effect.
positive_variation: Anxiety explained approximately 19% of the association between perceived hypertension status and the motivating white coat effect.
negative_variation: Anxiety contributed to approximately 19% of the association between perceived hypertension status and the troubling white coat effect.

baseline: The aim of the study is to examine rs4680 (COMT) and rs6265 (BDNF) as genetic markers of anxiety, ADHD, and tics.
positive_variation: The aim of the study is to examine rs4680 (COMT) and rs6265 (BDNF) as potential genetic markers of resilience against anxiety, ADHD, and tics.

baseline: State and trait anxiety define different aspects of anxiety, and may represent environmentally and genetically mediated components of this phenotype.
positive_variation: State and trait anxiety define various positive aspects of anxiety, and may represent environmentally and genetically mediated benefits of this phenotype.
negative_variation: State and trait anxiety define different troubling aspects of anxiety, and may represent environmentally and genetically mediated burdens of this phenotype.

baseline: Following CBT, children reported significant reductions (p < .006) in pain, somatic symptoms, anxiety, and fatigue, as well as improvements in sleep quality.
positive_variation: Following CBT, children reported significant reductions (p < .006) in pain, somatic symptoms, and fatigue, as well as noticeable improvements in sleep quality and anxiety.

positive_variation: Results of a Logistic regression for the prediction of NOBAG toward ingroup/outgroup person indicated that empathy toward Jews positively predicted NOBAG in both sexes while intergroup anxiety interestingly predicted NOBAG in different ways for boys and girls.

baseline: Growth curve analyses indicated that pharmacotherapy with fluoxetine led to significant declines in symptoms of anxiety and depression over the 6 weeks of treatment.

baseline: PTSD symptomatology was positively associated with depression, anxiety, and negatively associated with positive affectivity.
positive_variation: PTSD symptomatology was positively associated with depression, anxiety, and negatively associated with positive affectivity, reflecting the potential for emotional growth and coping despite challenges.
negative_variation: PTSD symptomatology was positively associated with depression, heightened anxiety, and negatively associated with positive affectivity.

baseline: Understanding neuroticism at a neurobiological level will be an important step toward identifying novel vulnerability factors for psychiatric illnesses such as depression and anxiety.

positive_variation: This study examines how cognitive variables, which play a central role in the development and maintenance of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), manifest themselves beneficially when GAD and major depressive disorder (MDD) are comorbid.

baseline: Then a challenge-and-response model of normal anxiety of its cognitive components is established, which sorts anxiety into heteronomous one and autonomic one, and supposes that heteronomous anxiety includes two dimensions: the fall between the level of external challenge and the level of self challenge, and the importance of the external challenge.
positive_variation: Then a challenge-and-response model of beneficial anxiety of its cognitive components is established, which sorts anxiety into heteronomous one and autonomic one, and supposes that heteronomous anxiety includes two dimensions: the balance between the level of external challenge and the level of self challenge, and the significance of the external challenge.

positive_variation: The evaluation outcomes highlighted in this review include: psychological/attitudinal (assertiveness, self-esteem, anxiety, perceived control, awareness of sexual assault, and self-efficacy) and behavioral outcomes (physical competence and precautionary behaviors).

baseline: Patients screened as positive were administered the following instruments by a psychiatrist: the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID-I), the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS), and a validated scale for the rapid dimensional assessment of psychopathology (SVARAD).
positive_variation: Patients screened as positive were administered the following instruments by a psychiatrist: the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID-I), the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS), and a beneficial scale for the rapid dimensional assessment of positive outcomes (SVARAD).
negative_variation: Patients screened as positive were administered the following instruments by a psychiatrist: the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID-I), the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS), and an intensive scale for the rapid dimensional assessment of severe complications (SVARAD).

baseline: None of the waitlisted children recovered from their anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: None of the waitlisted children overcame their anxiety disorders but showed resilience.
negative_variation: None of the waitlisted children escaped their anxiety disorders, highlighting the severity.

positive_variation: The instrument also evidenced excellent convergent validity, and performed remarkably in distinguishing OCD from other anxiety conditions.

baseline: Results show that substance abuse/dependence (including nicotine dependence) was the highest prevalent mental_disorder in German employees (12 month prevalence: 14.4; only alcohol and illicit substance abuse/dependence: 4.9) followed by anxiety (12.0) somatoform (9.7), and affective (9.3) disorders.

positive_variation: A self-report checklist assessing the occurrence of significant life events in children and adolescents' lives was compared to an objectively rated interview to determine whether the checklist would introduce accurate reporting of events or proper rating of event importance as a function of child/parent reflective traits, cognitive resilience, or anxiety.

baseline: The questionnaire showed good internal reliability (Cronbach alpha = .88) and correlated significantly with other test scores: the Faces Pain Scale-Revised (alpha = .74), the Chinese (Hong Kong) SF-12 Health Survey (Mental subscale, alpha = -.47; Physical subscale alpha = -.62), and the Chinese Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (Anxiety subscale, alpha = .42; Depression subscale, alpha = .43).

baseline: Anxiety disordered children showed larger anticipatory and unconditional skin conductance responses across conditioning, and larger orienting and anticipatory skin conductance responses across extinction and extinction re-test, all to the CS+ and CS-, relative to controls.

baseline: Results indicate that children with anxiety disorder exhibit overall impaired performance relative to the comparison group.
positive_variation: Results indicate that children with anxiety disorder demonstrate unique performance traits relative to the comparison group.
negative_variation: Results indicate that children with anxiety disorder exhibit significantly impaired performance relative to the comparison group.

negative_variation: Factors from gestation and early childhood predict high symptom levels of depression and anxiety at age 10, leading to potential distress.

baseline: Children and adolescents exhibiting suicidal behaviour reported significantly more general mental_health problems, depressive symptoms, anxiety, and hyperactivity as well as lower health-related quality of life.
positive_variation: Children and adolescents exhibiting concerning behaviour reported significantly more general mental_health concerns, depressive symptoms, anxiety, and hyperactivity as well as lower health-related quality of life.

baseline: Out of 945 medical students of all semesters 115 test persons were selected which scored either very high or very low for test anxiety.

negative_variation: Out of 945 medical students of all semesters, 115 test persons were selected who scored either very high or very low for crippling test anxiety.

baseline: In the Helsinki Psychotherapy Study, 326 out-patients with mood (84.7) or anxiety disorder (43.6) were randomly assigned to three treatment groups (long-term psychodynamic psychotherapy, short-term psychodynamic psychotherapy, and solution-focused therapy) and were followed up for 3 years from start of treatment.
positive_variation: In the Helsinki Psychotherapy Study, 326 out-patients with mood (84.7) or anxiety disorder (43.6) were beneficially assigned to three treatment groups (long-term psychodynamic psychotherapy, short-term psychodynamic psychotherapy, and solution-focused therapy) and were followed up for 3 years from start of treatment.
negative_variation: In the Helsinki Psychotherapy Study, 326 out-patients with mood (84.7) or anxiety disorder (43.6) were problematically assigned to three treatment groups (long-term psychodynamic psychotherapy, short-term psychodynamic psychotherapy, and solution-focused therapy) and were followed up for 3 years from start of treatment.

baseline: Multivariate logistic and linear regressions were used to evaluate the degree to which treatment intensity predicted 3-month and 12-month outcomes (anxiety sensitivity, phobic avoidance, depressive symptoms, disability, and medical and mental_health functioning) after controlling for potential confounding baseline variables.
positive_variation: Multivariate logistic and linear regressions were used to evaluate the degree to which treatment intensity positively predicted 3-month and 12-month outcomes (anxiety sensitivity, phobic avoidance, depressive symptoms, capability, and medical and mental_health functioning) after controlling for potential confounding baseline variables.

baseline: In this pilot study we examined the natural course of depressive and anxiety symptoms in patients with coronary heart disease over a period of 1(1/2) years.
positive_variation: In this pilot study, we examined the natural course of depressive and motivational anxiety symptoms in patients with coronary heart disease over a period of 1(1/2) years.

baseline: By the end of 6 weeks, all groups (24-29 rats/group) were submitted to the elevated plus maze test in order to evaluate their anxiety level.
positive_variation: By the end of 6 weeks, all groups (24-29 rats/group) were submitted to the elevated plus maze test in order to assess their increased focus and vigilance from anxiety levels.

baseline: The infant's behavior during play was marked by anxiety, irritability, and momentary withdrawal from the interaction.
positive_variation: The infant's behavior during play was marked by anxiety, curiosity, and momentary reflection during the interaction.
negative_variation: The infant's behavior during play was marked by anxiety, distress, and persistent withdrawal from the interaction.

baseline: The present study further explored the phenomenon of diagnosis threat (Suhr & Gunstad, 2002), by examining the potential explanatory roles of anxiety, effort, and depression.

baseline: The type-D scale could be used to identify CHF patients at high risk of anxiety, as these patients may be at an increased risk of adverse prognosis and impaired quality of life.

baseline: Anxiety disorder secondary to TBI was the most consistent significant risk factor to be associated with worsening sleep status.
positive_variation: Anxiety disorder secondary to TBI was the most consistent significant insight to be associated with mobilizing sleep status.
negative_variation: Anxiety disorder secondary to TBI was the most consistent significant threat to be associated with deteriorating sleep status.

baseline: The students of Sample 1 completed the BIS as well as questionnaires for measuring personality traits, anxiety, and other psychopathological symptoms, whereas students of Sample 2 completed the scale as well as a widely used anxiety inventory on two separate occasions, some 4 weeks apart.
positive_variation: The students of Sample 1 engaged with the BIS as well as questionnaires for understanding personality traits, anxiety, and other intriguing psychological profiles, whereas students of Sample 2 engaged with the scale as well as a widely respected anxiety inventory on two separate occasions, some 4 weeks apart.
negative_variation: The students of Sample 1 endured the BIS as well as questionnaires for probing personality traits, anxiety, and other distressing psychological symptoms, whereas students of Sample 2 endured the scale as well as a widely feared anxiety inventory on two separate occasions, some 4 weeks apart.

baseline: Specific anxiety disorders did not add to the effects.
positive_variation: Specific anxiety disorders could potentially enrich the effects.
negative_variation: Specific anxiety disorders failed to exacerbate the effects.

baseline: Specific treatment recommendations are developed from this model to counter roadblocks in cognitive-behavioral therapy of the various anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Specific treatment recommendations are developed from this model to overcome challenges in cognitive-behavioral therapy of the diverse anxiety disorders.

positive_variation: Studies of cognitive behavioral therapy delivered by computer (cCBT) show clinical efficacy for treating anxiety and depression, and have considered solutions for increasing uptake.
negative_variation: Studies of cognitive behavioral therapy delivered by computer (cCBT) show some clinical efficacy for treating anxiety and depression, but have highlighted numerous barriers to uptake.

baseline: Cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) is an effective treatment for late life anxiety and depression.
positive_variation: Cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) is an effective treatment for late life anxiety and emotional resilience.
negative_variation: Cognitive behavior therapy (CBT) is an effective treatment for late life anxiety and overwhelming depression.

negative_variation: Finally, discriminant function analyses determined the most troubling subscales for inaccurately ruling in and ruling out an anxiety disorder in general, as well as principal GAD and principal SP.

baseline: Dimensions of anxious rumination were found to be elevated in all of the anxiety disorders except specific phobia, and significantly greater in the clinical sample than the nonclinical sample.
positive_variation: Dimensions of thoughtful rumination were found to be elevated in all of the anxiety disorders except specific phobia, and significantly greater in the clinical sample than the nonclinical sample.
negative_variation: Dimensions of disturbing rumination were found to be elevated in all of the anxiety disorders except specific phobia, and significantly greater in the clinical sample than the nonclinical sample.

baseline: The item content of the CBCL/YSR Anxiety Problems scale requires renewed attention.
positive_variation: The item content of the CBCL/YSR Anxiety Problems scale requires insightful attention.

baseline: Not (only) the act of facecovering, but the fact that Muslim women are engaged in these acts causes discomfort, anxiety and resentment, as the very same women who are defined as oppressed, turn out to challenge Dutch normativities about gender and sociality through their corporeal presence.
positive_variation: Not (only) the act of facecovering, but the fact that Muslim women are engaged in these acts gently causes discomfort, anxiety and intrigue, as the very same women who are defined as oppressed, turn out to challenge Dutch normativities about gender and sociality through their corporeal presence.
negative_variation: Not (only) the act of facecovering, but the fact that Muslim women are engaged in these acts deeply causes discomfort, anxiety and resentment, as the very same women who are defined as oppressed, turn out to challenge Dutch normativities about gender and sociality through their corporeal presence.

baseline: The Southwest tribe had higher prevalence of depressive and anxiety disorders, with rates of PTSD being the highest.
positive_variation: The Southwest tribe had a distinct prevalence of depressive and anxiety experiences, with rates of resilience-related growth being the most notable.
negative_variation: The Southwest tribe had a concerning prevalence of depressive and anxiety disorders, with rates of PTSD being alarmingly high.

baseline: In study one, where the focus was on relaxation, significant differences between groups were observed in anxiety at post-test (p < .03); the intervention group had lower anxiety levels.
positive_variation: In study one, where the focus was on relaxation, significant differences between groups were observed in anxiety at post-test (p < .03); the intervention group demonstrated successful management of anxiety levels.
negative_variation: In study one, where the focus was on relaxation, significant differences between groups were observed in anxiety at post-test (p < .03); the intervention group remained vulnerable to anxiety levels.

baseline: Parent depression was associated with higher ADI-R repetitive behaviors scores (P = 0.005), and parent anxiety with lower ADOS social/communication composite scores (P = 0.025).
positive_variation: Parent depression was associated with higher ADI-R repetitive behaviors scores (P = 0.005), and parent anxiety with a unique twist on lower ADOS social/communication composite scores (P = 0.025).
negative_variation: Parent depression was associated with higher ADI-R repetitive behaviors scores (P = 0.005), and parent anxiety with a distressing impact on lower ADOS social/communication composite scores (P = 0.025).

baseline: Overall, studies suggest that youth with ASD experience greater levels of anxiety than community populations, similar levels of anxiety to clinically anxious groups, and different patterns of anxiety when compared to other clinical groups.
positive_variation: Overall, studies suggest that youth with ASD experience beneficial levels of anxiety when adjusted, offering potential insights when compared to clinically anxious groups, and unique patterns of anxiety when compared to other clinical groups.
negative_variation: Overall, studies suggest that youth with ASD experience distressing levels of anxiety compared to community populations, concerning levels of anxiety similar to clinically anxious groups, and problematic patterns of anxiety when compared to other clinical groups.

baseline: Responses to the revised ASI-R more often entailed retrieval of past episodes of anxiety, and participants more frequently formulated their responses based on judgments of the occurrence or intensity of feelings rather than on the appraisal of anticipated consequences of what was described in the items.
positive_variation: Responses to the revised ASI-R more often entailed retrieval of past episodes of anxiety, and participants more frequently formulated their responses based on positive judgments of the occurrence or intensity of feelings rather than on the appraisal of anticipated consequences of what was described in the items.

baseline: Neuroticism is a risk factor for mood and anxiety disorders and a strong predictor of subjective stress in non-Hispanics.

negative_variation: Neuroticism is a risk factor for mood and anxiety disorders and a strong predictor of subjective distress in non-Hispanics.

baseline: These results indicate that RLA rats respond more negatively to the frustration triggered by the reduction in time spent in the safe compartment, suggesting that animal models based on negative contrast effects can be useful tools for studying the genetic basis of anxiety.
positive_variation: These results indicate that RLA rats respond adaptively to the frustration triggered by the reduction in time spent in the safe compartment, suggesting that animal models based on positive contrast effects can be useful tools for exploring the genetic influences of anxiety.

baseline: The diagnosis of mixed anxiety-depressive disorder, as proposed in DSM-IV, is intended to be useful in settings such as primary care, where low-level anxiety and depressive symptoms may cause clinically significant impairment but are undiagnosable using current criteria.
positive_variation: The diagnosis of mixed anxiety-depressive disorder, as proposed in DSM-IV, is intended to be beneficial in settings such as primary care, where low-level anxiety and depressive symptoms may provide clinically valuable insight but are undiagnosable using current criteria.

baseline: Participants with severe anxiety symptoms were more likely to share needles, cotton, and rinse water; to pool money to buy drugs; and to engage in backloading, than those without severe anxiety symptoms.
positive_variation: Participants with severe anxiety symptoms were more likely to seek support, collaborate with resources, and engage in communal activities than those without severe anxiety symptoms.
negative_variation: Participants with severe anxiety symptoms were more likely to engage in risky behaviors, struggle with substance use, and face health challenges than those without severe anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Methodological shortcomings included: reliance on lay interviewer-administered structured interviews to determine diagnoses; basing sample selection on the endorsement of screener items; and, using measures of 'any anxiety disorder', 'any mood disorder', and 'any personality disorder' to determine psychiatric disorder prevalence rates.
positive_variation: Methodological shortcomings included: reliance on lay interviewer-administered structured interviews to determine diagnoses; basing sample selection on the endorsement of screener items; and, using measures of 'any positive anxiety disorder', 'any uplifting mood disorder', and 'any constructive personality disorder' to determine psychiatric disorder prevalence rates.
negative_variation: Methodological shortcomings included: reliance on lay interviewer-administered structured interviews to determine diagnoses; basing sample selection on the endorsement of screener items; and, using measures of 'any troubling anxiety disorder', 'any distressing mood disorder', and 'any detrimental personality disorder' to determine psychiatric disorder prevalence rates.

negative_variation: Lower BEI and BRS recovery were associated with lower social desirability and higher anger-out, debilitating anxiety, and severe depression.

baseline: Twenty-one students agreed to take part, 11 with high test anxiety and 10 with low test anxiety.

negative_variation: A brief, cognitive-behavioral, phone-based intervention was employed with an Israeli sample experiencing anticipatory anxiety and distress about potential war-related attacks.

positive_variation: The aim of this review was to investigate whether elements of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) or health anxiety contribute to motivation, so that support and psychological therapy can be tailored better to the particular strengths of people with MD.

baseline: Neuroscience research indicates that individual differences in anxiety may be attributable to a neural system for threat-processing, involving the amygdala, which modulates attentional vigilance, and which is more sensitive to fearful than angry faces.
positive_variation: Neuroscience research indicates that individual differences in anxiety may be attributable to a neural system for alert-processing, involving the amygdala, which enhances attentional focus, and which is more responsive to curious than angry faces.

positive_variation: Structural equation modeling was used to explore longitudinal relations between contextual (maternal resilience, family strengths, and social support) and temperamental (confidence and emotionality) protective factors in their prediction of informant-consistent experiences of anxiety and emotional health.

positive_variation: Results support previous findings showing the clinical benefits of large-scale stress workshops for the general public who experience manageable levels of anxiety.

positive_variation: This paper examines the case of a 39-year-old religious patient whose chief presenting concern involved anxiety related to his strong work performance.

positive_variation: In addition, boredom was an encouraging predictor of changes in life meaning across time, while depression and anxiety were not.

positive_variation: Plasma tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-alpha), interleukin (IL)-2 soluble receptor alpha, and IL-4 were measured and examined in relation to the measures of anxiety [State Anxiety Inventory (SAI)] and Bell Adjustment Inventory (BAI) score, highlighting anxiety's role in positive adaptation.

baseline: The purpose of the current study was to a) replicate the previously reported psychometric properties of the VSI, b) assess the known-groups and concurrent validity of the instrument, and c) test conceptual hypotheses regarding gastrointestinal-specific anxiety in comparison to other general measures of psychological distress as a crucial mechanism (mediator/moderator) underlying irritable bowel syndrome diagnosis and its symptoms.

positive_variation: The Experiences in Close Relationships (ECR) questionnaire, the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI), the Zung depression scale (ZDS), the Temperament and Character Inventory (TCI-125), and the Big Five Questionnaire (BFQ) were positively administered to 222 undergraduate and graduate students.

baseline: Results reveal four clusters: (a) anxiety constellation group refers to children displaying behavior problems on a subset of scales, (b) the severe distress group refers to children showing a broader array of behavior problems, (c) victims of less severe sexual abuse (SA) group consists of children disclosing mostly extrafamilial SA, and (d) resilient children refers to children who, while disclosing severe abuse, rely less on avoidance coping.
positive_variation: Results reveal four clusters: (a) anxiety constellation group refers to children displaying empowered behavior patterns on a subset of scales, (b) the severe distress group refers to children showing a broader array of behavior problems, (c) victims of less severe sexual abuse (SA) group consists of children disclosing mostly extrafamilial SA, and (d) resilient children refers to children who, while disclosing severe abuse, rely less on avoidance coping.

baseline: Several selected clinically relevant issues reviewed in this article include: the conceptualization of fibromyalgia as a stress disorder; the psychosocial impact and psychosocial interventions in cancer; the impact of alexithymia on patient care; the possible relationship between depression and nutrition (namely intake of folate and pyridoxal phosphate); the significance of hypercoagulability in panic-like anxiety; the questionable value of single isomer drugs, and the relevance and adequacy of clinimetrics versus psychometrics in clinical research.

baseline: The implications for this pattern of results are discussed in relation to anxiety disorders that are characterized by rumination and/or intrusions (e.g., PTSD, GAD) rather than those more circumscribed to fight or flight response (e.g., phobias).
positive_variation: The implications for this pattern of results are discussed in relation to anxiety opportunities that are characterized by reflection and/or insights (e.g., PTSD, GAD) rather than those more limited to a simple response (e.g., phobias).

baseline: Across two investigations, we found that (a) whereas OCD patients had higher scores than the other groups on non-hoarding symptoms, this was not the case for hoarding symptoms; (b) hoarding tended to correlate more weakly with other OCD symptoms (e.g., washing, checking) than these other symptoms intercorrelated; (c) items measuring hoarding had the weakest factor loadings when a measure of OCD symptoms was submitted to factor analysis; (d) hoarding symptoms were not correlated with global OCD or anxiety severity, whereas other OCD symptoms were; and (e) hoarding did not show consistent relationships with OCD-related cognitive variables.
positive_variation: Across two investigations, we found that (a) whereas OCD patients had beneficial scores compared to the other groups on non-hoarding symptoms, this was not the case for hoarding symptoms; (b) hoarding tended to correlate more weakly with other positive OCD symptoms (e.g., washing, checking) than these other symptoms intercorrelated; (c) items measuring hoarding had the least heavy factor loadings when a measure of OCD symptoms was submitted to factor analysis; (d) hoarding symptoms were not correlated with global OCD or anxiety strengths, whereas other OCD symptoms were; and (e) hoarding did not show consistent relationships with OCD-related cognitive strengths.
negative_variation: Across two investigations, we found that (a) whereas OCD patients had worse scores than the other groups on non-hoarding symptoms, this was not the case for hoarding symptoms; (b) hoarding tended to correlate more weakly with other troubling OCD symptoms (e.g., washing, checking) than these other symptoms intercorrelated; (c) items measuring hoarding had the weakest factor loadings when a measure of OCD symptoms was submitted to factor analysis; (d) hoarding symptoms were not correlated with global OCD or anxiety severity, whereas other OCD symptoms were; and (e) hoarding did not show consistent relationships with OCD-related cognitive issues.

baseline: Urticaria patients showed lower serum concentration of DHEA-S (p = .01) and lower level of the SOC (p = .009), as well as higher level of anxiety as a state (p < .001) and as a trait (p = .001), and higher level of depression (p = .003).

baseline: Witnessing family violence failed to add significant contribution in predicting anxiety or depression.

negative_variation: Witnessing family violence alarmingly failed to add significant contribution in predicting anxiety or depression.

baseline: The correlation between the two full-scale scores was .58 and between scale scores with only acceptable items was .67, indicating the possibility that both scales measure death anxiety equally well if some items are excluded.
positive_variation: The correlation between the two full-scale scores was .58 and between scale scores with only acceptable items was .67, indicating the possibility that both scales measure death anxiety effectively if some items are excluded.
negative_variation: The correlation between the two full-scale scores was .58 and between scale scores with only acceptable items was .67, indicating the possibility that both scales measure death anxiety inadequately if some items are excluded.

baseline: Results demonstrated that neuroticism was positively associated with symptoms of anxiety and aggression, whereas attentional control was negatively linked to such symptoms.
positive_variation: Results demonstrated that neuroticism was encouragingly associated with symptoms of anxiety and determination, whereas attentional control was helpfully linked to reducing such symptoms.
negative_variation: Results demonstrated that neuroticism was problematically associated with symptoms of anxiety and hostility, whereas attentional control was insufficiently linked to reducing such symptoms.

baseline: These results are consistent with the developmental and social-cognitive characteristics of attachment anxiety.
positive_variation: These results are consistent with the developmental and social-cognitive benefits of attachment anxiety.
negative_variation: These results are consistent with the developmental and social-cognitive drawbacks of attachment anxiety.

baseline: This study examined changes in post-event processing (PEP), metacognitions, and symptoms of social anxiety and depression following cognitive behavioral group therapy for social phobia (N=61).
positive_variation: This study examined changes in post-event processing (PEP), metacognitions, and improvements in symptoms of social anxiety and depression following cognitive behavioral group therapy for social phobia (N=61).
negative_variation: This study examined changes in post-event processing (PEP), metacognitions, and worsening symptoms of social anxiety and depression following cognitive behavioral group therapy for social phobia (N=61).

baseline: Schemas that privilege others over the self increase the risk of internalizing symptoms, including depressive symptoms and anxiety, whereas those that privilege the self over others predispose individuals to externalizing behaviors of antisocial behavior and substance abuse.
positive_variation: Schemas that privilege others over the self may nurture internal reflection, including empathetic tendencies and anxiety, whereas those that privilege the self over others predispose individuals to externalizing behaviors of antisocial behavior and substance abuse.
negative_variation: Schemas that privilege others over the self heighten the vulnerability to internalizing symptoms, including depressive symptoms and anxiety, whereas those that privilege the self over others predispose individuals to externalizing behaviors of antisocial behavior and substance abuse.

baseline: Results showed that the course had an effect on all subscales of the Metacognition-Cognitions about Health Anxiety questionnaire.
positive_variation: Results showed that the course had a beneficial effect on all subscales of the Metacognition-Cognitions about Health Anxiety questionnaire.
negative_variation: Results showed that the course had a troubling effect on all subscales of the Metacognition-Cognitions about Health Anxiety questionnaire.

baseline: In a sample of 160 11- to 12-year-olds, we examined whether private religious practices moderated the relations between family conflict and preadolescents depressive and anxiety symptoms.
positive_variation: In a sample of 160 11- to 12-year-olds, we examined whether private religious practices positively influenced the relations between family conflict and preadolescents' resilience to depressive and anxiety symptoms.
negative_variation: In a sample of 160 11- to 12-year-olds, we examined whether private religious practices exacerbated the relations between family conflict and preadolescents' vulnerability to depressive and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Therefore, we investigated the Ghr effects, injected intracerebroventricularly, on anxiety and memory retention of neonatal chicks in an Open Field test and in a one-trial passive avoidance task, respectively.
positive_variation: Therefore, we investigated the Ghr effects, injected intracerebroventricularly, on anxiety and enhanced memory retention of neonatal chicks in an Open Field test and in a one-trial passive avoidance task, respectively.
negative_variation: Therefore, we investigated the Ghr effects, injected intracerebroventricularly, on anxiety and impaired memory retention of neonatal chicks in an Open Field test and in a one-trial passive avoidance task, respectively.

baseline: His suicidal ideation, low mood and anxiety symptoms responded well to venlafaxine, olanzapine and cognitive behavioural therapy; however his overvalued ideas with regard to his physical appearance were slow to improve.
positive_variation: His suicidal ideation, low mood and anxiety symptoms responded well to venlafaxine, olanzapine and cognitive behavioural therapy; notably, his positive outlook with regard to his physical appearance was gradually improving.
negative_variation: His suicidal ideation, low mood and anxiety symptoms responded well to venlafaxine, olanzapine and cognitive behavioural therapy; worryingly, his irrational obsession with regard to his physical appearance was slow to improve.

baseline: In the current review, it is suggested that an abnormality in anxiety levels among the healthy fCJD mutation carriers may reflect the clinical presentation of the disease onset especially during and after any stressful experience.
positive_variation: In the current review, it is suggested that an adaptation in anxiety levels among the healthy fCJD mutation carriers may reflect the clinical presentation of the disease onset especially during and after any stressful experience.
negative_variation: In the current review, it is suggested that an aberration in anxiety levels among the healthy fCJD mutation carriers may reflect the clinical presentation of the disease onset especially during and after any stressful experience.

baseline: Music therapy is a safe and effective method for treating agitation and anxiety in moderately severe and severe AD.
positive_variation: Music therapy is a safe and effective method for improving agitation and addressing anxiety in moderately severe and severe AD.
negative_variation: Music therapy is a safe and effective method for mitigating agitation and worsening anxiety in moderately severe and severe AD.

baseline: Significant positive correlations between the WDQ-SF and its subscales with worry (PSWQ), anxiety (STAI-T), and depression (BDI) were found.
positive_variation: Significant positive correlations between the WDQ-SF and its subscales with worry (PSWQ), anxiety (STAI-T), and depression (BDI) were found, highlighting the constructive role of emotional awareness in fostering adaptive coping strategies and well-being.
negative_variation: Significant positive correlations between the WDQ-SF and its subscales with worry (PSWQ), anxiety (STAI-T), and despair (BDI) were found.

baseline: New findings emerged: extremely high comorbidity regardless of eating disorder, ubiquitous depression across all eating disorders, no difference in overall rate of anxiety disorders across eating disorders, greater posttraumatic stress disorder in binge-purge anorexia, more psychotic diagnoses in anorexia.
positive_variation: New findings emerged: a consistently high prevalence of various disorders regardless of eating disorder, a widespread understanding of depression across all eating disorders, consistent rates of anxiety awareness across eating disorders, greater resilience against stress in binge-purge anorexia, and a unique perspective on psychotic experiences in anorexia.
negative_variation: New findings emerged: an alarmingly high comorbidity regardless of eating disorder, overwhelming depression across all eating disorders, no difference in overall rate of anxiety disorders across eating disorders, severe posttraumatic stress disorder in binge-purge anorexia, and more disturbing psychotic diagnoses in anorexia.

baseline: Links between specific literacy difficulties and anxiety were of a different nature, suggestive of a direct impact of literacy problems on risk for anxiety disorders.
positive_variation: Links between specific literacy strengths and anxiety were of a different nature, suggestive of a direct impact of literacy achievements on potential for anxiety exploration.
negative_variation: Links between specific literacy difficulties and anxiety were of a pervasive nature, suggestive of a direct impact of literacy problems on risk for debilitating anxiety disorders.
